newsitem.title: INDIA: India's ITC appoints two new directors.
newsitem.headline: India's ITC appoints two new directors.

text.p: Indian tobacco and hotel conglomerate ITC Ltd said on Monday that its board had appointed Ram S. Tarneja and B. Vijayaraghavan as independent, non-executive directors of the company.
ITC said in a statement that its nominations committee comprising the chairman and all non-executive directors recommended to the board the appointment of Tarneja and Vijayaraghavan.
"The Board unanimously approved their appointment with immediate effect," the statement said.
"With their induction the governance will be strengthened and help propel the company forward," it said.

Earlier on Monday the company reported a 28 percent rise in net profit in the first half of 1996/97 (April-March) to 1.81 billion rupees, and said it looked forward to bright business prospects in coming years.
Britain's B.A.T Industries Plc is the biggest single shareholder in ITC with a 31.7 percent stake.
